item.title: 诺和诺德母公司重新提交康泰伦特交易的美国申请
item.description: Wegovy生产商诺和诺德的母公司诺和诺德公司已向美国联邦贸易委员会（FTC）重新提出申请，要求批准其斥资165亿美元收购生产分包商康泰伦特公司（Catalent）的交易。【原文：The parent of Wegovy producer Novo Nordisk has refiled an application to the U.S. Federal Trade Commission (FTC) for approval of a $16.5 billion deal to buy manufacturing subcontractor Catalent , a spokesperson said on Monday.】

item.title: 尽管原油价格达到 90 美元，但美国石油产量因天然气价格疲软而受限
item.description: 美国原油价格上周攀升至今年以来的最高点，但天然气市场疲软、成本上升以及对股东回报而非新产量的关注，使得页岩油钻探商无法大幅提高这个世界头号油气生产国的产量。【原文：U.S. crude oil prices last week climbed to their highest this year, but a weak natural gas market, steeper costs and a focus on shareholder returns over new production are keeping shale drillers from big output increases in the world's top oil and gas producer.】

item.title: 独家报道佩尔佩图阿资源公司获准为锑矿申请 18 亿美元美国贷款
item.description: Perpetua Resources 公司已收到美国进出口银行 (EXIM) 的意向书，希望获得价值高达 18 亿美元的贷款，用于在爱达荷州北部开发锑金矿，这是华盛顿州不断发展的战略的一部分，旨在抵消中国在关键矿产领域的主导地位。【原文：Perpetua Resources has received a letter of interest from the U.S. Export-Import Bank (EXIM) for a loan worth up to $1.8 billion to develop an antimony and gold mine in northern Idaho, part of Washington's evolving strategy to offset China's critical minerals sector dominance.】

item.title: 早间竞价美联储 6 月缩表令华尔街黯然失色
item.description: Mike Dolan 展望美国和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan】

item.title: 聚焦：美国低收入人群消费减少，大型食品公司提供优惠和新尺寸
item.description: 依靠政府福利购买食品和其他必需品的美国人正在削减开支，这促使卡夫-海因茨（Kraft-Heinz）和 Conagra Brands 等食品制造商在多年涨价之后，对其产品和战略进行全面改革。【原文：Americans relying on government benefits to buy food and other essentials are slashing spending, prompting food makers like Kraft-Heinz and Conagra Brands to overhaul their products and strategies following years of price hikes.】

item.title: 圭亚那天然气发电项目将使石油产量减少数周，影响收入
item.description: 圭亚那努力利用其天然气资源为一家发电厂提供燃料，以降低这个南美国家的能源成本，但该发电厂的建设因延误而受阻，并有可能使这个冉冉升起的石油热点国家今年的收入减少约 10 亿美元。【原文：Guyana’s efforts to use its natural gas resources to fuel a power plant that would slash the South American nation's energy costs have snagged on construction delays and threaten to curtail the rising oil hotspot's revenue this year by about $1 billion.】

item.title: 独家报道马斯克神经链接公司的竞争对手 Synchron 准备进行大规模大脑植入试验
item.description: 埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的 Neuralink 脑植入初创公司的竞争对手 Synchron Inc 首席执行官告诉路透社记者，该公司正准备招募患者参加一项大规模临床试验，该试验是其设备获得商业批准所必需的。【原文：Synchron Inc, a rival to Elon Musk's Neuralink brain implant startup, is preparing to recruit patients for a large-scale clinical trial required to seek commercial approval for its device, the company's chief executive told Reuters.】

item.title: 谷歌酝酿巨额交易将引发与监管机构的新斗争
item.description: 谷歌母公司 Alphabet 拟收购营销软件公司 HubSpot，这很可能会引发监管机构的反对，尽管许多专家都认为这不会抑制竞争，而且这将要求这家科技巨头在与反垄断监管机构的斗争中开辟一条新战线。【原文：Google parent Alphabet's contemplated acquisition of marketing software company HubSpot would likely spark opposition from regulators even as many experts agree it would not curb competition, and would require the technology giant to open a new front in its battle with antitrust watchdogs.】

item.title: 台积电为亚利桑那州芯片生产赢得 66 亿美元美国补贴
item.description: 美国商务部周一表示，将为台湾积体电路制造股份有限公司（台积电）美国分公司在亚利桑那州凤凰城的先进半导体生产提供66亿美元的补贴，以及高达50亿美元的低成本政府贷款。【原文：The U.S. Commerce Department said Monday it would award Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co's (TSMC) U.S. unit a $6.6 billion subsidy for advanced semiconductor production in Phoenix, Arizona and up to $5 billion in low-cost government loans.】

item.title: 条款表显示，三星电子股票将在 3.3 亿美元的大宗销售中发售
item.description: 根据路透社周一看到的一份条款书，三星电子约 525 万股股票将在一笔价值高达 3.3 亿美元的大宗交易中发售。【原文：About 5.25 million shares in Samsung Electronics are being offered in a block deal worth up to $330 million, according to a term sheet seen by Reuters on Monday.】

item.title: 欧元区 4 月投资者士气创两年新高
item.description: 周一的一项调查显示，4月份欧元区投资者士气连续第六个月回升，达到两年多来的最高水平。【原文：Investor morale in the euro zone improved for the sixth consecutive month in April to its highest level in more than two years, a survey showed on Monday, adding that even though Germany remained a drag it showed "economic signs of life".】

item.title: 如果你打不过他们？尽管担心安全问题，欧洲政治家们还是接受了 TikTok
item.description: 当西蒙-哈里斯在今年三月成为爱尔兰的候任总理时，他转向了一个他最喜欢的平台来表达自己：TikTok。【原文：When Simon Harris became Ireland's prime minister-in-waiting in March, he turned to a favoured platform to express himself: TikTok.】

item.title: 中国希尔豪斯 2023 年对冲基金资产大幅下降
item.description: 一份美国监管文件显示，亿万富翁张磊的希尔豪斯投资公司去年对冲基金资产骤减三分之一，降至275亿美元。【原文：Billionaire Zhang Lei's Hillhouse Investment saw its hedge fund assets plummet by a third last year to $27.5 billion, a U.S. regulatory filing showed.】

item.title: 曼谷车展订单量增长 28%，丰田汽车销量领先
item.description: 泰国曼谷国际车展的主办方周一表示，本届车展的订单量增长了 27.5%，其中丰田汽车的销量居首，尽管电动汽车的发展势头迅猛，但传统汽车仍占主导地位。【原文：Thailand's Bangkok International Motor Show recorded a 27.5% rise in orders, with Toyota leading sales, while traditional cars still dominated despite electric vehicles gaining pace, its organiser said on Monday.】

item.title: 阿里云宣布下调离岸数据中心产品价格
item.description: 在吸引人工智能软件开发商的竞争日益激烈之际，中国阿里巴巴云周一表示，将把由其离岸数据中心提供支持的产品价格下调多达59%。【原文：China's Alibaba Cloud on Monday said it will cut prices for products that are powered by its offshore data centers by as much as 59% amid rising competition to attract artificial intelligence software developers.】

item.title: 中国人在长假周末的消费猛增，超过 COVID 前的水平
item.description: 政府数据显示，在刚刚过去的清明节假期，中国游客在国内消费了 75 亿美元，分析人士认为，这一增长表明消费者信心正在增强，这对疲软的经济来说是个好兆头。【原文：Chinese travelers spent $7.5 billion domestically during the recent Tomb Sweeping holiday, government data showed, with analysts saying the uptick was a sign that consumer confidence was strengthening, boding well for the sluggish economy.】

item.title: 中国滴滴和广汽 Aion 将于明年量产机器人出租车
item.description: 中国打车巨头滴滴出行（Didi Global）表示，其自动驾驶部门与电动汽车制造商广汽爱安（GAC Aion）的合资企业已获得在中国大规模生产电动机器人出租车的许可，并计划从明年起销售这种汽车。【原文：Chinese ride-hailing giant Didi Global said its self-driving unit's joint venture with EV maker GAC Aion has received a license to mass produce electric robotaxis in the country, and that it plans to sell the cars from next year.】

item.title: 耶伦称美国不会接受新产业被中国廉价进口产品所淘汰
item.description: 美国财政部长珍妮特-耶伦（Janet Yellen）周一警告说，美国不会接受新产业因中国进口产品的补贴而衰落，就像十年前美国钢铁业被击垮一样。【原文：U.S. Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen warned on Monday that the United States would not accept new industries being decimated by subsidized Chinese imports in the same way that the U.S. steel sector was crushed a decade ago.】

item.title: 瑞银合资公司收购瑞士信贷日本财富管理业务
item.description: 瑞银集团（UBS）周一表示，其与 SuMi TRUST Wealth Management Co.【原文：UBS said on Monday its Japanese wealth management joint venture with SuMi TRUST Wealth Management Co, will acquire Credit Suisse's wealth management business in Japan following the Swiss bank's absorption of its stricken rival in 2023.】

item.title: 日本服务业景气下滑，为日本央行加息之路蒙上阴影
item.description: 一项政府调查显示，由于生活成本上升和恶劣天气影响了消费，日本 3 月份服务业景气度下降，这加剧了央行能否尽快再次加息的不确定性。【原文：Japan's service-sector sentiment fell in March as rising living costs and bad weather weighed on consumption, a government survey showed, heightening uncertainty on how soon the central bank can raise interest rates again.】

item.title: 瑞士政府 "大而不能倒 "的建议对瑞银构成威胁
item.description: 瑞士政府将于本月提交旨在保护国家免受银行被视为 "大而不能倒 "风险的提案，以应对瑞银集团 2023 年收购瑞士信贷后成为该国唯一大型贷款机构的情况。【原文：The Swiss government will this month present proposals aimed at protecting the country against the risk of banks deemed "too big to fail" in response to UBS's emergence as the country's sole big lender with its 2023 takeover of Credit Suisse.】

item.title: 聚焦：汇丰高管表示，汇丰将目标瞄准富有的外籍人士，看好亚洲公司，以推动欧洲业务部门的发展
item.description: 汇丰银行欧洲区首席执行官押注于地区财富的增长和亚洲企业客户的海外扩张，以提高该部门对集团利润的贡献，在此之前，经过多年的重启，该业务已从落后者变为利润引擎。【原文：HSBC's European chief is betting on rising regional wealth and overseas expansion by Asian corporate clients to boost his unit's contribution to group profit after a multi-year reboot turned the business from laggard to profit engine.】

item.title: 瑞银濒临瑞士 "大到不能倒 "的清算边缘
item.description: 自从一年前瑞银拯救了其陷入困境的竞争对手瑞士信贷银行（Credit Suisse）之后，瑞银就一直在等待当局如何保护瑞士免受该国仅存的一家大银行也发生内讧的风险。它马上就要知道了。【原文：Since UBS rescued its stricken rival Credit Suisse a year ago, it has been waiting to hear how authorities will protect Switzerland from the risk of the country's only remaining big bank also imploding. It is about to find out.】

item.title: 前日本外汇主管称日元走软 "随时 "可能引发干预措施
item.description: 日本一位前高级货币官员周一告诉路透社，如果日元走势过度，足以采取干预行动，日本当局 "随时 "都可能干预外汇市场，以阻止日元大幅下跌。【原文：Japanese authorities could intervene in the foreign exchange market to stem sharp falls in the yen “at any time” if its moves are excessive enough to warrant such action, a former top currency official in Japan told Reuters on Monday.】

item.title: 现代汽车和起亚将与印度 Exide Energy 公司合作开发电动汽车电池
item.description: 现代汽车公司（Hyundai Motor Co）和起亚汽车公司（Kia Corp）周一与印度 Exide Energy Solutions Ltd 公司就在印度生产电动汽车（EV）电池签署了谅解备忘录。【原文：Hyundai Motor Co and Kia Corp on Monday signed a memorandum of understanding with India's Exide Energy Solutions Ltd on battery production for their electric vehicles (EVs) in India.】

item.title: 最后一关欧洲央行的五个问题
item.description: 押注欧洲央行几乎肯定会在 6 月开始降息的交易员们只需要决策者们在周四亮出绿灯，证明一切已经明朗。【原文：Traders betting the European Central Bank is all but certain to start cutting interest rates in June just need a green light from policymakers on Thursday that the coast is clear.】

item.title: 丰田汽车丑闻缠身的大发公司调整小型车业务结构
item.description: 日本大发汽车公司（Daihatsu Motor）周一表示，将就开发和认证问题向母公司丰田汽车公司（Toyota Motor）直接汇报，因为这家紧凑型汽车制造商正努力克服认证测试安全丑闻。【原文：Japan’s Daihatsu Motor said on Monday it will set up a direct reporting line on development and certification to its parent Toyota Motor , as the compact car maker seeks to overcome a certification test safety scandal.】

item.title: 财政部官员称中美将举行更多金融冲击演习
item.description: 美国财政部官员表示，美中两国正在深化在金融稳定问题上的合作，在最近一次应对大型银行倒闭的演习之后，两国还计划进行两次模拟金融冲击的演习。【原文：The U.S. and China are deepening cooperation on financial stability issues, U.S. Treasury officials said, with two more simulations of financial shocks scheduled after a recent exercise on dealing with the failure of a large bank.】

item.title: 早间竞标：紧张的市场等待充满行动的一周
item.description: 安库尔-班纳吉（Ankur Banerjee）对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Ankur Banerjee】

item.title: 耶伦会见中国央行行长，就产能过剩问题施压
item.description: 美国财政部长珍妮特-耶伦（Janet Yellen）将结束在中国为期四天的会晤，并访问中国央行，她将向中国领导人施压，要求控制过剩的工业产能并刺激内需。【原文：U.S. Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen is set to wrap up four days of meetings in China with a visit to the central bank as she presses her case for Chinese leaders to rein in excess industrial capacity and boost domestic demand.】
